intro: Tithymalus petiolatus, commonly known as the slender tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers full sun and moderate watering.
